nodes.bodyText: Could you add a comment here that links the documentation of the below rules? I'm assuming https://eslint.org/docs/rules/ but maybe you have a better or more accurate link
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -27,7 +27,10 @@ module.exports = {
   // The rules found here were ported and categorized using the tslint migration roadmap:

nodes.bodyText: Am I missing something? We have many places where we ignore this and I haven't see warnings about it. FWIW I support removing this rule
I'm not sure about allowSingleLine: true, though I don't feel very strongly on this point. Specifically, I think in most cases where you're doing this, you should probably just omit the brackets.
What's the rationale for making all of these warnings rather than errors? I'm not entirely sure of the implications of this.
I would like one of these options: "ignoreUrls": true or "ignoreComments": true; often you need a include a long URL in a comment, and wrapping it is nonsensical.

nodes.bodyText: I think this setting is good to have. do you have a good reason for disabling it?

Per PR description, these are commented out to indicate intent to enable the rules as written in a follow-up PR. If they are applied now, they will generate warnings which need to be fixed, which is outside the scope of this PR / ticket.
Isn't  this  one auto-fixable? Is it talking about horizontal or  vertical spacinig?
Most of these rules are auto-fixable - this PR is meant to get agreement on the rule set. In future PR's we can auto fix one at a time.
@calbach - I added eslint to the lint command
nodes.diffHunk:

     "test": "ng test --source-map=false",
     "test-react": "jest",
-    "lint": "ng lint --type-check",
+    "lint": "ng lint --type-check && yarn eslint src --ext ts,tsx",
